results.content:
There were a few things that seem to be missed out; for instance showing that you can use private methods or private variables from public methods.

There were also a few places where the audio went silent for no apparent reason and I thought something had broken.

The "tests" were a bit too simplistic and can probably be "solved" through ways different to how you're meant to solve them, but I feel that may be down to how they are evaluated.

Ultimately I did learn more about how OOP works in Javascript.

response.content: Thanks for posting your positive review and feedback - Glad you enjoyed the course. If you have any questions please post them in the Q&A section - I check that regularly to help answer course questions. Have a wonderful day.

results.content:
Good introduction but lacking real-world examples or context. Tutor needs to pause and step through the code though.
It's more a demo of how to set up methods within objects. Good demonstration of private and public functions.
Overall, a good start for understanding what OO JS is about in principle. Needs more realistic examples and some more engaging exercises.

results.content: I learned about objects and used them a bit when I started learning web development months ago,but in the front-end/ data visualization projects I did/am doing to learn, I didn't have the need to use more advanced features than a generic object with keys and values. This was a very good refresher, helped me get the concept of some new things as well as made me think and realize why some exercises I remember trying to do in the past weren't giving me what I was expecting.

results.content: This is a good beginning level course for learning the object-oriented nature of Javascript. I thought the instructor was generally very clear, though I personally could have used a little more exposition about how Javascript's object oriented features differ from more standard class-oriented OOP, such as Java or C++. Overall, Laurence is clear and easy to understand.
